concept.title: Entering Functions
concept.shortdesc: This section explains how to enter a function with the wizard.

conbody.p: If you are experienced and know the name and construction of a function, then you can just type the function in the formula bar. Usually, it is more convenient to use the Function Wizard. You can activate this Wizard in two ways:

ul.li: By clicking on the Insert Function button at the beginning of the formula bar.
Through Formulas Insert Function (group Function Library)

conbody.p: In both cases the dialog box Insert Function appears:

For quick finding of the correct function, it is useful to first select the category. This can be done by clicking the selection arrow in the category box. The categories appear in the drop-down window. Select the desired function, for example, COUNTIF, click OK, and then the Function Arguments dialog box appears.
In this dialog box, you can specify the arguments. What argument(s) you should specify depends on the selected function.
conbody.note: By clicking the link Help on this function you get detailed help for the function.
